definition: East Germany (1945-1990)/German Democratic Republic 德意志民主共和國|德意志民主共和国[De2 yi4 zhi4 Min2 zhu3 Gong4 he2 guo2]
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
Wudongde, the name of a hydroelectric dam on the Jinsha River 金沙江[Jin1 sha1 jiang1] at a point where the river forms a border between Yunnan and Sichuan

sentences.english: Each East German citizen received 100 marks from the West German state.
sentences.chinese: 每个东德市民将在西德收到100马克欢迎费。

sentences.english: That was the reason for and the guarantee of the GDR’s very being.
sentences.chinese: 那是东德自身存在的理由和保障。

sentences.english: 1973 - East and West Germany are admitted to the United Nations.
sentences.chinese: 1973年的今天，东德和西德被准入联合国。

sentences.english: There are many examples, especially with East Germans.
sentences.chinese: 例子很多，尤其在前东德就不计其数。

sentences.english: It sits on land that was formerly on the East German side of the checkpoint.
sentences.chinese: 纪念碑坐落在检查哨过去东德这一侧的土地上。

definition: East and West Germany/refers to the German Democratic Republic (East Germany) and the Federal Republic of Germany (West Germany)

pinyin: Jie2 ke4 Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4

definition: West Germany/German Federal Republic 德意志聯邦共和國|德意志联邦共和国[De2 yi4 zhi4 Lian2 bang1 Gong4 he2 guo2]

pinyin: De2 yi4 zhi4 Min2 zhu3 Gong4 he2 guo2

definition: Soviet Union, 1922-1991/abbr. for Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) 蘇維埃社會主義共和國聯盟|苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟[Su1 wei2 ai1 She4 hui4 zhu3 yi4 Gong4 he2 guo2 Lian2 meng2]
Leningrad, name of Russian city Saint Petersburg 聖彼得堡|圣彼得堡 1923-1991
